data.title: Famous Deaths on February 27
data.meta_description: Famous deaths for the 27th of February. See which celebrities, historical figures, scientists and criminals died throughout history on February 27.
data.text:
Robert of Melun, English philosopher and bishop of Hereford, dies

Johan van Heemskerk, Dutch lawyer/writer/interpreter, dies

Henry Dunster, American clergyman and first President of Harvard College, dies at 49

Luisa de Guzmán, Queen of Portugal (1640-56), dies at 52

Charles Paulet, 1st Duke of Bolton, English politician (b. c. 1625)

John Evelyn, English writer and diarist (Life of Mrs Godolphin), dies at 85

Bahādur Shah I, 8th Mughal Emperor of India (1702-12), dies at 68

Samuel Parris, English-born Puritan minister (b. 1653)

Angelo Predieri, Italian composer, dies at about 76

John Arbuthnot, Scottish mathematician and writer (Scriblerus Club), dies at 67

Jan Nepveu, Dutch governor of Suriname (1769-79), dies at 59

Francis Marion, American military officer, sometimes known as "the Swamp Fox", (pioneered guerrilla warfare during the American Revolutionary War), died around the age of 63

Benvenuto Robbio San Raffaele, Italian composer, dies at 61

Stefan Paluselli, Austrian choirmaster, composer, and monk, dies at 57

Nicholas Biddle, US lawyer/diplomat/statesman/financier, dies at 85

Joseph Drechsler, Czech composer, dies at 69

Gabriele dell' Addolorata, [Francesco Possenti], Italian priest, saint and mystic, (patron of Italian Catholic youth), dies at 23

Justus Hiddes Halbertsma, Dutch Frisian writer, poet (Rhymes & Tales), lexicographer and linguist, and minister, dies at 79

Carlos Manuel de Céspedes, Cuban revolutionary hero, dies at 54

George Colley, British governor of Natal/general, dies in battle at 46

Alexander Borodin, Russian composer and scientist (Robert LeDiable), dies at 53

Anne Clough, English suffragette, promoted higher education for women, first principal of New College, dies at 72

Louis Vuitton

French founder of the Louis Vuitton brand of leather goods now owned by LVMH, dies at 70

Samuel Pierpont Langley, American astronomer and pioneer aviator, dies at 71

Adam Sedgwick, English zoologist (Peripatus), dies at 58

Alexandru Dimitrie Xenopol, Romanian historian, dies at 72

Schofield Haigh, English cricket fast bowler (11 Tests, 24 wickets, BB 6/11; Yorkshire CCC), dies from a stroke at 49

Manuel Manrique de Lara, Spanish composer (The Oresteia), dies at 65

Chandra Sekhar Azad, Indian revolutionary (Hindustan Socialist Republican Army), dies at 24

William Southam, Canadian newspaper publisher, dies at 88

Ivan Pavlov

Russian physiologist and pioneer in psychology (Nobel Prize 1904), dies at 86

Joshua W. Alexander, U.S. Secretary of Commerce under Woodrow Wilson (b. 1852)

Nadezhda Krupskaya, Russian revolutionary (Central Committee member, Soviet Minister for Education, wife of Vladimir Lenin), dies at 70

Peter Behrens, German architect, dies at 71

William D. Byron, U.S. Congressman (b. 1895)

Karel Doorman, Dutch rear-admiral (Java Sea), KIA at 52

1942 Martha McChesney Berry, American educator who founded Berry School for Children, dies at 75

Kostis Palamas, Greek poet, twice nominated for the Nobel prize (b. 1859)

HJ Lochtman, Dutch chaplain/resistance fighter, dies in Bergen-Belsen

James Cecil Parke, Irish tennis player (Australasian C'ship singles & doubles, Davis Cup 1912; Wimbledon doubles 1914) and rugby union centre (20 caps; Leinster Rugby), dies at 64

Francis MacKinnon, English cricket batsman (1 Test; Kent CCC) and 35th Chief of MacKinnon clan, dies at 98

Ivan Goll, French-German writer (the Landless John), dies at 58

Henry Louis Smith, American physicist who made the first X-ray photograph, dies at 91

Theodoros Pangalos, Greek general and dictator (1926), dies at 74

Tom Howard, Irish-American vaudeville and radio comedian (It Pays To Be Ignorant), dies of heart disease at 66

Frank Dailey, American orchestra leader (Music at Meadowbrook), dies at 54

1956 Gunther Ramin, German organist and composer, dies at 57

Harry Cohn, CEO (Columbia Pictures), dies of a heart attack

Adriano Olivetti, Italian engineer and manufacturer (typewriter), dies at 58

Platt Adams, American field athlete (Olympic gold standing high jump 1912), dies at 75

Willie Best, actor (Charlie-My Little Margie), dies at 45

William Auchterlonie, Scottish golfer (British Open 1893), dies at 90

Orry-Kelly, Australian costume designer (b. 1897)

Frankie Lymon, American pop singer (The Teenagers - "Why Do Fools Fall In Love"), dies of a heroin overdose at 25

1968 Johannes Tralow, German writer (Ottoman tetralogy), dies at 85

1968 Ludvik Podest, Czech composer, music journalist, and conductor dies at 46

John Boles, American singer and actor (Stella Dallas, Curly Top), dies at 73

1969 Marius Barbeau, French Canadian ethnologist and folklorist, dies at 85

Marie Dionne, one of the French Canadian Dionne quintuplets (b. 1934)

1970 Robert Bruce Lockhart, diplomat/writer, dies

Pat Brady [Robert Ellsworth O'Brady], American actor (The Roy Rogers Show, Man from Music Mountain), dies at 57

Lucijan Marija Skerjanc, Yugoslav conductor and composer, dies at 72

Neville Cardus, English writer and cricketer, dies at 86

Allison Hayes, American model and actress (Attack of the 50 Foot Woman), dies of leukemia or lead poisoning at 47

1977 John Dickson Carr, American mystery writer, dies of lung cancer at 70

Vadim Salmanov, Soviet Russian composer, dies at 65

George Tobias, American actor (Bewitched), dies at 78

Jacob H Gilbert, American politician (US Representative 1960-1971), dies at 60

Malika Sabirova, Soviet Tajik ballet dancer, dies at 39

David Huffman, American actor (FIST, Jane Doe, Firefox, Onion Field), murdered at 39

1985 Henry Cabot Lodge Jr., American politician (Sen-R) and ambassador (West Germany, Vietnam & UN), dies at 82

1985 J Pat O'Malley, Irish-British actor (101 Dalmatians, The Jungle Book), dies at 80

1985 Ray Ellington [Henry Pitts Brown], British jazz drummer, singer and bandleader (The Goon Show), dies of cancer at 68

Jacques Plante

Canadian Ice Hockey goalie who was the first to wear a goaltender mask, dies of stomach cancer at 57

Joan Greenwood, British actress and director (Kind Hearts and Coronets, Amorous Mr Prawn), dies of a heart attack at 65

Conrad Lorenz, Austria zoologist (Nobel 1973), dies

1989 Joseph "Joe" Silver, American actor (Lenny, Mr I Magination), dies of liver cancer at 66

1989 Konrad Lorenz, Austrian zoologist and ethologist (Man & His Ideas, Nobel Prize 1973), dies at 85

1989 Paul Oswald Ahnert, German astronomer, dies at 91

Les Ames, English cricket wicket-keeper/batsman (47 Tests, 97 dismissals, 2,434 runs @ 40.56), dies at 84

1990 Nahum Norbert Glatzer, Jewish-American scholar (b. 1903)

Hein van Royen, Dutch director of the Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra (1974-91), dies at 52

1991 Robert Widlar, American engineer and inventor of linear integrated circuits, dies of a heart attack at 53

1991 Robert-Jan Akkerman, Dutch diplomat (to Tunis), murdered

S. I. Hayakawa, Canadian-American academic, politician (U.S. Senator from California, 1977–83) and writer (Language in Action), dies of a stroke at 85

Jose Duval, actor (Juan Valdez), dies at 72

1993 Lillian Gish, American silent film/stage actress (Birth of a Nation), dies at 99

1993 Marģeris Zariņš, Latvian composer and writer, dies at 82

1993 Marlena Davis, American pop singer (The Orlons - "Don't Hang Up"; "South Street"), dies of lung cancer at 48

"Hans" Leopold Kohr, Austrian social philosopher and economist, dies at 84

1994 Harold Acton, English-Italian historian and art collector, dies at 84

1994 Karl Pelgrom, Dutch sculptor involved in the art movement De Ploeg, dies at 66

1994 Laurence Craigie, American aviator (1st US jet pilot), dies at 92

1994 Roosevelt Holts, American blues singer and guitarist, dies at 89

Bernard Cornfield, financier, dies at 67

1995 Philip Sherrington, opus Dei Priest, dies at 51

Francois Chaumette, French actor (Le Bossu, They Never Slept, Christine), dies at 72

1996 George Ian Murray, 10th Duke of Atholl, dies at 64

1996 Pat Smythe, English equestrian rider (Olympic bronze team jumps 1956; author children's books), dies from heart disease at 67

1996 Sarah Palfrey Cooke, American tennis player (US Nat C'ship 1941, 45), dies of lung cancer at 83

1996 Sylvia Williams, museum director/curator, dies at 60

1996 Vic Janowicz, American College Football Hall of Fame halfback (Heisman Trophy 1950, Ohio State; NFL: Washington Redskins), dies of cancer at 66

Kingsley Davis, American sociologist and demographer (coined the term "population explosion"), dies at 88

George H. Hitchings

American medical doctor (Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine, 1988), dies at 92 [1]

J. T. Walsh, American actor (Good Morning, Vietnam, Pleasantville), dies of a heart attack at 54

Horace Tapscott, American jazz pianist and composer (Pan Afrikan Peoples Arkestra, 1961-98), dies at 64

Spike Milligan

Irish-British actor and comedian (The Goon Show, 3 Musketeers), dies of kidney failure at 83

Fred Rogers

American children's TV host (Mr. Rogers' Neighborhood), Presbyterian minister, dies of stomach cancer at age 74

John Lanchbery, British-Australian composer and conductor (Royal Ballet, 1959-72; Australian Ballet, 1972-77; American Ballet Theatre, 1978-80), dies at 79

Paul Sweezy, American Marxist economist and editor (Monthly Review), dies at 93

2004 Yoshihiko Amino, Japanese historians (b. 1928)

Allan Rae, Jamaican cricketer (prolific WI opening batsman 1948-53), dies at 82

Linda Smith, British comedian (b. 1958)

2006 Milton Katims, American violist and conductor (Seattle Symphony, 1954–76), dies at 96

2006 Otis Chandler, American newspaper publisher (b. 1927)

2006 Robert Lee Scott, Jr., American General and Air Force pilot, dies at 97

Bernd von Freytag-Loringhoven, German soldier (b. 1914)

2007 Bobby Rosengarden, American jazz drummer and bandleader, dies of Alzheimer's disease at 82

Anthony Blond, British publisher (The Publishing Game, Book Book), dies at 79

2008 Boyd Coddington, American auto designer (owner Boyd Coddington Hot Rod Shop) and television host (American Hot Rod on TLC), dies of sepsis at 63

2008 Myron Cope, American sports broadcaster (b. 1929)

2008 William F. Buckley Jr, American conservative author and commentator (National Review, Firing Line), dies of a heart attack at 82

Madeleine Ferron, French Canadian writer, dies at 87

Duke Snider

American Baseball Hall of Fame outfielder (8 x MLB All Star; World Series 1955, 59; Brooklyn / LA Dodgers), dies at 84

Eddie Kirkland, Jamaican-American blues guitarist, singer and harmonica player (Have Mercy On Me), dies in a car accident at 87

2011 Frank Buckles, last surviving American World War I veteran (b. 1901)

Tina Strobos, Dutch physician and resistor to Nazi occupation, dies from cancer at 91

Dale Robertson, American actor (Death Valley Days, Tales of Wells Fargo, The Iron Horse), dies at 89

2013 Richard Street, American R&B musician (The Temptations), dies at 70

2013 Stephane Hessel, German-born French diplomat, dies at 95

2013 Van Cliburn, American pianist (Tchaikovsky Competition winner, 1958), dies at 78

Boris Nemtsov, Russian politician, dies at 55, after being shot four times in Moscow

Leonard Nimoy

American actor (Star Trek - "Spock"'; Mission Impossible, 1969-71), and director (Star Trek III: The Search for Spock; Three Men and a Baby), dies of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease at 83

2015 Malcolm Boyd, American Episcopal Priest, author and civil rights activist, dies at 91

2015 Tod Dockstader, American electronic and musique concrète composer, dies at 82

George Kennedy, American actor (Cool Hand Luke, Naked Gun films), dies at 91

Jórunn Viðar, Icelandic pianist and composer, dies at 98

Luciano Benjamín Menéndez, Argentine general, Commander of the Third Army Corps (1975-79), and convicted human rights violator and murderer, dies of cardiogenic shock at 90

Bill Playle, New Zealand cricket batsman (8 Tests), dies at 80

2019 Christopher Payne, British police officer (Chief Constable of the Cleveland Constabulary, 1976-90), dies at 89

2019 Doug Sandom, British drummer (The Who, 1962-64), dies at 89

2019 France-Albert René, 2nd President of Seychelles (1977-2004), dies at 83

2019 Nathaniel Taylor, American actor (Rollo-Sanford & Sons), dies at 80

Hanna Havrylets, Ukrainian composer (David's Psalms; Ėlegiya), and educator, dies of an aneurysm at 63

Sonny Ramadhin

West Indian cricket spin bowler (43 Tests, 158 wickets, BB 7/49), dies at 92

Ricou Browning, American film stuntman (Creature from the Black Lagoon), stunt co-ordinator (Thunderball), director, and producer (Flipper), dies at 93 [1]

John Fairchild, American magazine publisher and editor (Women's Wear Daily, 1960-96; W Magazine, 1972-97), dies at 87

Richard Lewis

American comedian and actor (Anything But Love; Robin Hood: Men in Tights; Curb Your Enthusiasm), dies of a heart attack at 76 [1]
